domains.description:
Situé au cœur de l’appellation d’origine, sur le sommet du coteau, le Domaine du Haut Pécharmant étale ses 35 ha de vignes basses, exposées plein sud. Héritier d’une tradition vigneronne de cinq générations, depuis 1929 la famille Roches exploite ce terroir de sables et de graviers du Périgord avec ses argiles grises et rouges ferrugineuses. Les cépages merlot, malbec et cabernets donnent des vins très raffinés, à la richesse et aux bouquets remarquables. 
Découvrez librement nos chais -avec espace musée-  et vignes (parcours avec explications en français, anglais et hollandais). Visites guidées juillet / aout (voir site). Visites et dégustation sont gratuites.

domains.description:
Corbiac, coeur originel de Puycharman, vignoble aujourd'hui appelé Pécharmant et implanté au XI° siècle par les Comtes du Périgord sur les coteaux argilo-sableux au nord-est de Bergerac, se transmet depuis 1587 au sein de la famille du célèbre Cyrano de Bergerac.
Cette connaissance du terroir, acquise par 17 générations successives de vignerons, et une culture respectueuse des traditions et cépages (Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon et Malbec) confèrent une grande richesse à notre production en Pécharmant...

domains.description:
Le Château du XVIIIe siècle est situé à Lembras sur la route nationale 21, dominant Bergerac avec une exposition plain sud, à flanc de coteau sur un terroir argilo-ferrugineux.
Notre vignoble de 34 hectares, d'un seul tenant, représente 10 % de l'ensemble de la production de vin rouge d’Appellation d'Origine Contrôlée Pécharmant.
Vin de fête du Périgord le Pécharmant est un vin rouge de garde, élevé en fût de chêne, composés de 4 cépages. Bien charpenté, fruité et généreux, après trois ans en bouteille ce vin dévoile tous ses secrets.
Nous ne manquerons pas de vous les faire découvrir en notre domaine où vous serez assurés de notre meilleur accueil.

domains.description:
Magnifique demeure inscrite à l’inventaire des monuments historiques, le château de la Jaubertie fut une propriété de chasse d’Henri IV au XVIe siècle, qui l’offrit par la suite à sa maîtresse Gabrielle d’Estrée. Trônant fièrement au milieu des 52 hectares de vignes du domaine à 10 km au sud de Bergerac et à quelques minutes de Monbazillac, il est le cadre idéal d’une découverte des vins AOC Bergerac rouge, blanc et rosé.
Depuis les bâtiments aux belles portes cintrées, admirez le vignoble et pénétrez ensuite dans les chais où les cuves inox modernes cohabitent avec les fûts de chêne dans lesquels vieillissent les meilleures parcelles. Terminez votre visite dans la vaste salle de dégustation, digne du cadre historique du château de la Jaubertie, nous serons ravis de vous faire apprécier toute la gamme de nos vins, dont la célèbre cuvée Mirabelle.
domains.plus: La magnifique propriété classée monument historique.

domains.description:
En 1984, Christian ROCHE a hérité d'une partie de la propriété familiale et en 1989, il a aménagé son chai de vinification afin de devenir vigneron indépendant.
Dans cette optique, il a réalisé qu'il fallait revenir sur les fondamentaux (terme rugbystique cher à notre sud ouest ) à savoir la terre et la plante.
La vraie question est: quels sont les besoins de la plante pour produire de beaux raisins permettant d'élaborer le meilleur vin possible ?
Depuis quelques années, le respect de l'environnement, le travail du sol en profondeur pour un meilleur enracinement, l'implantation des cépages, les densités de plantation, les sélections massales ont contribué à satisfaire notre volonté de gains qualitatifs. Ces préoccupations ont pris, depuis 2012, un tour plus concret : nous sommes en effet en Agriculture Biologique.

domains.description:
Au cœur de la Maison des Vins de Bergerac, le Cloître des Récollets est lié depuis toujours à l’histoire du vignoble bergeracois et de ses hommes.
Aujourd’hui, cette demeure bâtie autour d’une cour intérieure élégante, au coeur du vieux Bergerac, garde ses allures XVIIème, mais a su allier la beauté de ses pierres aux besoins de la Maison des Vins et de l’Interprofession des Vins de Bergerac et Duras. 
Promenez-vous librement du Cloître des Récollets à la Vinothèque, en passant par le Caveau de la Vinée, et découvrez l’exposition permanente "Le Vin est Voyage". Fresque historique de l’ère tertiaire à nos jours, diaporama, table sensorielle,...laissez-vous guider dans ce voyage à travers le temps et les sens ! 
La Maison des Vins c’est aussi le lieu idéal pour s’initier aux secrets de la dégustation dans le cadre d’une splendide salle et avec les les conseils d’un(e) œnologue.

domains.description:
Depuis 1896, les générations de la famille CASTAING se succèdent sur ce vignoble de Pomport qui produit des vins de Bergerac et Monbazillac. Depuis toujours le Domaine de Grange Neuve est ouvert au public. Labellisé Bienvenue à la Ferme, Vignobles et découverte, Ferme Pédagogique, Haute Valeur Environnementale et membre de la Route des Vins, le domaine accueille les visiteurs souhaitant découvrir le monde du vin, et l'histoire de la viticulture en Bergeracois, pour une simple dégustation gratuite jusqu'à une visite plus complète du vignoble et des chais (sur rendez-vous) pour percer les secrets de l'élaboration du vin. 
Le domaine dispose également d'un gîte grande capacité pouvant accueillir jusqu'à 13 personnes, primé d'un Best of d'Or Wine Tourism 2016.

Représentant la cinquième génération de vignerons sur l’exploitation, Nicole Maury a repris le flambeau familial et apporte des touches féminines à l’évolution du domaine, notamment en s’engageant résolument dans l’oenotourisme. Elle ouvre tout d’abord un gîte puis, avec l’aide de ses enfants et de son époux Hervé qui élève des limousines et des blondes d’Aquitaine, elle met en place des moments conviviaux pour vous familiariser avec les vins du domaine de Coutancie (AOC rosette, bergerac rouge, sec et rosé ou côtes de bergerac) et possibilité d'acheter des morceaux.

Située au sud de Bergerac, l’exploitation borde l'appellation ‘Monbazillac’ et est principalement constituée d’un long plateau de trois kilomètres de long, jouissant ainsi de terroirs très divers.

domains.description:
1610 : C'est la date butoir de l'arbre généalogique de la famille Barde sur la commune de Saint Méard de Gurçon. Depuis cette époque, les générations vont se succéder et développer le patrimoine actuel.
Cette vieille demeure située à l'ouest de Bergerac (30 km) ressemble,
sans être une gentilhommière du Périgord, à une maison de maître
datant du XVII ème siècle. Sur le toit à la Mansarde, trônent deux généreuses
girouettes fleurdelisées représentant un dauphin.
Ici donc en Périgord Pourpre, la famille Barde, exploite, vinifie et commercialise
la production d'un vignoble de 60 ha, répartis comme suit :                                                                
- 30 ha de cépages blancs : Sauvignon, Sémillon et Muscadelle.
- 30 ha de cépages rouges : Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon et Malbec.

Les vignes sont restructurés à plus de  5000 pieds par hectare ,constitué à 50% de cépages blancs (Sauvignon, Sauvignon Gris, Sémillon, Muscadelle et Chenin) et 50% de cépages rouges (Merlot, Cabernet franc,cabernet Sauvignon et Malbec), elles bénéficient d’une très belle exposition sur coteaux. "In monte revelationem"
Nous nous inscrivons dans les pas de Michel de Montaigne en élaborant des vins responsables, vous faisant ainsi partager le plasir de la révélation.
Des vignes à perte de vue, entrecoupées de bosquets … 
Vous êtes sur les côteaux de Lamothe Montravel, dans la vallée de la Dordogne. Entre Castillon-la-Bataille et Ste-Foy-la-Grande, nous vous accueillons à 2 km du château de Montaigne, sur notre domaine viticole de 9 hectares en AOC Montravel rouge et blanc, Bergerac rouge et rosé. Situé sur le coteau nord de la commune de Bergerac, le Château du Rooy est une jolie propriété du XIXème siècle que nous avons reprise en 1998.
Elle dispose d’un vignoble diversifié où d’importants investissements ont été réalisés tant au niveau des vignes que du chai de vinification.
Avec un domaine de
19 hectares de vignes réparties sur trois appellations, nous élaborons nos vins en tenant compte du terroir et en respectant la biodiversité par la pratique
d'une agriculture raisonnée.
Contrairement aux propriétés familiales, le Château du Rooy est tout d'abord une aventure viticole dans laquelle nous nous sommes lancés afin de recréer et développer le domaine au fil du temps.
Aujourd'hui nous continuons de restructurer l’exploitation dans le but d'améliorer les conditions de production ainsi que la qualité
de nos vins.

Tirant son nom du vieux français qui signifiait « côtes » ou « coteaux », le Domaine des Costes est situé à Bergerac, l’une des quatre communes produisant des vins de l’appellation Pécharmant.
Depuis 1992, une attention toute particulière est alors portée au vignoble : replantation en vignes étroites, de faibles rendements, culture raisonnée de la vigne, entretien du sol sans désherbant… Depuis 2003, la vigne est conduite en culture biologique dans un souci écologique, bien sûr, mais également dans le but de laisser le terroir s’exprimer au mieux. Nous produisons des vins de Pécharmant ronds, concentrés et de longue garde avec de la finesse et de l’élégance. Un vin rosé aux arômes délicats vient compléter la gamme. C’est un élément indispensable pour mettre en valeur les jeunes plantations.

domains.description:
C’est au cœur du terroir de Monbazillac, sur une colline surplombant les rives de la Dordogne et la cité historique de Bergerac, que sont produits depuis des décennies les vins du Château Grande Maison.
Cette ancienne maison forte du XIIIème siècle dispose des qualités d’un environnement unique :
- L’exposition générale est plein sud et toutes les parcelles sont en coteaux plus ou moins accentués.
- Son étang au cœur du domaine est un atout exceptionnel pour favoriser le botrytis, ce champignon qui fait toute la singularité et la richesse du Monbazillac
- Terroir argilo-calcaire avec un affleurement de silice qui donne une certaine acidité.
Dans une optique toujours qualitative, l’ensemble de la production est soumis aux règles de l’agriculture biologique auxquelles vient s’ajouter la méthode biodynamique, ce qui permet à nos vins d’exprimer tout leur caractère.

Chateau La Brie est situé au coeur du vignoble de Bergerac, sur les côteaux de Monbazillac, disposant de 35 hectares répartis sur 2 terroirs. D'origine privée, le domaine est racheté en 1962 par les communes de Bergerac et de Monbazillac afin que le Ministère de l'Agriculture y implante un Lycée agricole et viticole.
Le domaine viticole est un véritable outil pédagogique, confronté aux réalités économiques et environnementales, qui permet de former les viticulteurs de demain.
Depuis 2013, le Château La Brie est titulaire du niveau III de la norme HVE (haute valeur environnementale) qui reconnaît officiellement les pratiques respectueuses de l'environnement mises en oeuvre sur l'exploitation : la biodiversité, la stratégie
phytosanitaire, la gestion de la fertilisation et la maîtrise des ressources en eau.
De plus, il est certifié en Agriculture Biologique depuis 2013 sur 12 ha

Le Domaine de Perreau est une propriété familiale de 20 hectares sur les appellations Bergerac et Montravel. Gaëlle Reynou-Gravier, jeune vigneronne, cinquième génération, a repris le domaine en 2013 et lui construit une nouvelle identité, à la fois féminine et moderne.
Depuis 2014, le Domaine de Perreau est certifié Terra Vitis®, pour le plaisir du vin et une terre vivante. Vous pouvez y visiter les vignes et le chai. En 2018, Gaëlle développe une nouvelle offre familiale, un sentier dans les vignes autour de la biodiversité. Petits et grands pourront découvrir le métier de vigneron au travers d'un parcours de 1,5 km riche d'explications et de petits jeux. La visite se termine par une dégustation pour les parents et un goûter pour les enfants.

domains.description: Voilà plus de 25 ans que Thierry a repris la tête du domaine familial. Les vins sont vendus à l'export et en France en caves et restaurants. C'est dans la maison du domaine, une demeure girondine du XIXème siècle que vous serez reçus pour la dégustation.

domains.description:
Nous vous invitons à la découverte des vins créés par Fabien Castaing sur la propriété familiale du Domaine de Moulin-Pouzy transmise de Père en Fils depuis 1898. La propriété de 55ha de vignes est certifiée Exploitation de Haute Valeur environnementale. Vous pourrez y déguster nos Bergerac rouge, rosé et blanc sec, ainsi que nos Côtes de Bergerac blanc et nos Monbazillac. 
Nous vous proposons de découvrir également nos vins du Château Les Mailleries. Ce vignoble de 11ha est cultivé en agriculture biologique AB. Nous y produisons des Bergerac Rouge et Bergerac Blanc sec.
De nos cuvées traditionnelles à nos cuvées les plus extravagantes (comme nos vinifications en cuve ovoïde), nous vous ferons voyager dans notre univers où le respect de la nature est primordial, afin de récolter de beaux raisins et vous apporter le
meilleur de notre savoir faire et de notre terroir.

domains.description:
Situé au cœur de l’appellation de Bergerac, sur la commune de Monbazillac, Château MONTDOYEN domine avec élégance un vignoble établi sur les coteaux alentours. La propriété s’étend sur 83 hectares dont 37 plantés en vignes, le reste se répartissant entre prés et bois.
Pour préserver cet environnement exceptionnel, mais aussi pour exprimer au mieux la typicité de notre terroir, l’ensemble du domaine est travaillé en conciliant approche bio et lutte raisonnée: engrais verts, désherbage mécanique pour favoriser la vie des sols…
Ainsi, Château MONTDOYEN s’est vu décerner de nombreuses médailles tant à Lyon, Bordeaux, Bruxelles qu'au Concours Général Agricole de Paris. Le Guide Hachette en reconnaît également la qualité en lui ayant déjà attribué plusieurs coups de cœur, le classant ainsi parmi les références de l’appellation.
Nous proposons une palette de vins répartie sur six appellations.

domains.description:
En agriculture Biologique depuis 1989, adhérent à la mention Nature et Progrès, j’accompagne mon vignoble dans le Respect des terroirs, de sa biodiversité, profitant de la richesse de la faune auxiliaire et de la flore spontanée pour donner au terroir toute son expression.
Sur un sol bien pourvu en énergie, la vigne bien accompagnée, puise tout ce dont elle a besoin pour produire des raisins qui, une fois cueillis, chouchoutés, révèlent tous leurs arômes, arômes de fruits et surtout richesse du terroir.
Je suis paysan-vigneron, pas apprenti sorcier !!!
Après une cueillette manuelle, les vins révélés dans mes chais sont honnêtes et authentiques.
Pas de levure sur mes vins, pas de chaptalisation ni artifices œnologiques, doses de sulfites très modérées.
Chaque millésime est le reflet de l’année. Chaque millésime raconte son histoire.

Le Clos du Breil est une exploitation familiale située à proximité du village médiéval d’Issigeac. L’exploitation comprend 9,5 hectares de vigne.
Au Clos du Breil le travail de la vigne et les vinifications sont dictés par plusieurs principes : la patience, l’humilité et le partage. Une grande attention est portée au travail de la vigne (travail sous le rang avec un inter-cep, plus de désherbage chimique) afin de magnifier l’expression du terroir composé de calcaires d’Issigeac auxquels se mêlent des silex.
Afin de proposer une gamme de vins en adéquation avec nos principes, nous vendangeons nos parcelles en fonction de l’évolution aromatique des baies. Nous prenons soin de vinifier chaque parcelle et chaque cépage séparément jusqu’à l’assemblage final.
Nous proposons différentes cuvées. Des vins souples sur le fruit et des vins typés de caractère qui font la réputation du domaine.

Doriane passionnée par le vin, s’installe en 2006 comme vigneronne. Tout est à faire. La construction du chai débute en 2007 pour la première vinification du domaine.
Grand millésime et savoir-faire reconnu par la Vinalie d’Or Internationale.
Julien rejoint sa compagne dans l’aventure dès le millésime 2010. Sa jeunesse et sa passion pour la vigne donnent un formidable élan à l’exploitation.Il entreprend l’amélioration du vignoble
L’arrivée de nouvelles technologies entraîne une mise à niveau du chai de vinification et de la salle de mise en bouteille.
Doriane s’ouvre au commerce, Julien à la technique, leur fusion se retrouve aujourd’hui dans leurs vins.

Château Thénac a une longue et fabuleuse histoire. Les premières traces de son existence remontent à 1109 lorsqu’un prieuré bénédictin fut construit à l’emplacement de l’actuel Château.
La propriété, de plus de 200 hectares au total, se trouve sur le village de Thénac. Le vignoble s’étend à perte de vue autour du Château. La propriété est également composée d’une plantation de pruniers d’ente, de bois, d’étangs et de terres cultivables.
La vigne est plantée sur le prolongement de la fameuse croupe calcaire de St Emilion. L’altitude, comprise entre 150 et 200 mètres, confère la présence d’un microclimat proche de celui de Bordeaux. Il  permet aux raisins de mûrir dans les meilleures conditions tout en gardant leur fraîcheur aromatique.
Les cépages plantés sont Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc et Malbec pour les rouges ; Sauvignon, Sémillon et Muscadelle pour les blancs.
domains.plus: La vue à couper le souffle depuis le château construit sur les ruines d'un ancien prieuré bénédictin.
domains.title: Château Thénac

domains.description:
Au cœur d’un vaste domaine viticole de 19 hectares trône le Magnifique Château de Montaigne, demeure du XIXème entièrement meublée d’époque, et la Tour Historique de Michel Eyquem de Montaigne, célèbre humaniste, auteur des Essais. 
Tout au long de l’année, vous pouvez parcourir ces lieux chargés d’Histoire lors de visites guidées et conclure par une dégustation de nos vins. Un voyage gustatif et visuel à couper le souffle. 
Visites guidées uniquement selon horaires
domains.plus: Le château du célèbre auteur des essais, Michel Eyquem de Montaigne !
domains.title: Château Michel de Montaigne

domains.description:
Situé dans le village de Monestier, le Chateau Monestier La Tour cultive 27.5 ha de vignes. Nous produisons des vins rouges en AOP Bergerac, Côtes de Bergerac, blancs secs, rosés et un liquoreux sous AOP Saussignac.
Depuis juin 2016, le Château Monestier La Tour bénéficie d’un nouveau cuvier, de nouveaux bâtiments de stockage et d’un accueil au public. Au-delà de cette restructuration, ce sont surtout les nouvelles pratiques culturales qui sont la vraie révolution, en effet le vignoble est en conversion biologique (le millésime 2018 sera certifié bio) et bio dynamique sur les conseils de Derenoncourt consultants. La culture apparaît dès lors plus respectueuse du terroir et de l’environnement, idées fondamentales du propriétaire.
domains.title: Château Monestier La Tour

domains.description:
Le Château des MIAUDOUX est une exploitation agricole que Gérard et Nathalie Cuisset ont acquis en 1987. Ils se sont alors lancés dans la production et la commercialisation de vin de Bergerac ( blancs sec et moelleux, rosé et rouge) et de Saussignac sur 25 ha, ainsi que dans  la production de pruneaux d'agen sur 8 ha.
En 2003, ils décident de convertir l'exploitation à l'agriculture Biologique, certifiée par Ecocert.  
En 2014 avec l'installation sur l'exploitation de leur fils ainé et son épouse, Samuel et Lisa, toute l'exploitation est aussi convertie en biodynamie, certifiée par Demeter. 
De ce fait, quelques jeunes parcelles sont travaillées en prestation avec un cheval dans le but de reprendre contact avec le monde animal et de minimiser l'impact du travail du sol.
Aux Miaudoux, la qualité des vins est recherchée.
Depuis 2009, une cuvée est vinifiée sans ajout de sulfites pour faire
domains.title: Château Les Miaudoux

domains.description:
Ayant fait carrière dans l’environnement, Laurent Russac a préféré retrouver son environnement à lui : la vigne ! Avec ce retour aux sources il a décidé de concilier ses deux passions : la vigne et l’environnement. Il a convertit le domaine familial en Bio en 2014. 
La propriété viticole s'étend sur 24 ha et bénéficie de l'appellation Monbazillac.
Venez découvrir nos vins, nos vignes et la biodiversité locale.

Le Clos du Pech Bessou se situe dans le Sud Bergeracois sur la commune de Plaisance et à la limite du Lot et Garonne, région touristique puisque proche des Bastides d'Issigeac et d'Eymet.
Le Clos du Pech Bessou est un petit vignoble de 8Ha mené dans la tradition familiale par Sylvie et Pascal THOMASSIN afin de mettre en avant l'authenticité de son terroir.Nous apportons un grand intérêt à la culture de la vigne (agriculture raisonnée) afin d'avoir des fruits de qualité qui nous permettront d'avoir un potentiel de vinification et de satisfaire notre clientèle.
L'encépagement est composé de merlot, cabernet, malbec, sémillon et muscadelle qui permettent de présenter des vins aux typicités variées.
Nous vous invitons à venir déguster nos vins avec grand plaisir avec un accueil simple et chaleureux.
A très bientôt!

traductions.description: The Domaine du Haut Pécharmant has 35 hectares of vineyards on the top of the hill, in the heart of the Pécharmant appellation. The family bought the property in 1929, ever since, five generations have been working the soils of sand, pebbles and and grey and red clay, rich in iron. The grape varieties merlot, malbec, cabernet franc and cabernet sauvignon are the ingredients of our remarkable wines, full bodied and with a rich bouquet.

Corbiac, original heart of Puycharman, now called Pécharmant, was established during the XIth century by the Counts of Perigord on the sandy-clay soils in North-East Bergerac. Since 1587, it has been passing on to the family of the famous Cyrano de Bergerac.
This knowledge of the land, acquired by 17 successive generations of winemakers, and a respectful culture of traditions and grape varieties (Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec) give a great wealth to our production in Pécharmant.

Gathering 50 winemakers, the Monbazillac cellar is the most important producer of Monbazillac appellation wines. Our winemakers have signed up for continuous improvement initiative. We vinify and commercialize wines from various castles which were known under Dutch brands during the XVIIth century.
Creation date: 1940
50 winemakers and 10 employees
927 hectares of vines and 28,000 hectoliters produced per year.
Production area: Bergerac, Colombier, Eymet, Monbazillac, Saint-Laurent des Vignes, Pomport, Rouffignac de Sigoulès
2 subsidiaries with 24 employees

Welcome to Alliance Aquitaine, a cooperative cellar which gathers 133 winegrowers representing the appellations of Bergerac, Côtes de Bergerac, Montravel, Côtes de Montravel, Monbazillac, Pécharmant and Bordeaux. Representing a total of 1,356 hectares, with 95% that are certified by Agri Confiance (quality, health and environment norm).
Alliance Aquitaine is represented by 3 production sites and 3 direct selling stores in Bergerac, Le Fleix and Saint Vivien.
Come and taste our wines and discover our “400 barrels” winery on Bergerac’s site.
Free access to the barrels warehouse on demand.

Easy to find, you will be amazed and seduced by the warehouses and shop of Château La Vieille Bergerie. We produce every color of Bergerac wines in order to satisfy the most experienced tasters.
We will advise you in French or in English.

This XVIIIth century castle is situated in the town of Lembras, 6 km from  Bergerac.

Built on the top of a hill, it dominates the region and offers an unforgettable setting, between vineyards and forests. The Pécharmant, its appellation contrôlée vineyard, faces south and covers 40 hectares. The ground rich in iron gives to this "vin de garde" a subtle bouquet, and its incomparable taste makes it one of the finest products of the Dordogne.
If on your trip you come to the Périgord, we will ensure you the best reception.

Only 12kms south of Bergerac, take advantage of your stay in our beautiful region to disciver one of the finest wine estates nearly. In a remarkable historic site, we would be delighted to welcome you for tasting the full range of our renowned wines, including the famous Mirabelle cuvee.

In 1984, Christian ROCHE inherited from a part of the family property, and in 1989 he created his wine cellar in order to become an independent winemaker.

In this way, he realized he had to come back to the basics, that is to say the land and the plant.

The real question is: what are the needs of the plant to produce great grapes to create the best wine possible?

For a few years now, the respect of the environment, deep soil working, grape varieties implantation, plantation densities and the special selections have improved the quality of the wine. And since 2012, they are working in organic agriculture.

Driven by a passion for wine, I left my native Belgium in 1999 in order to become a winemaker in Monbazillac (south of Bergerac) in the Périgord-Dordogne region. On my small vineyard holding of almost 10 hectares, I make with passion Monbazillac wines, as well as red, rosé, dry white Bergerac and sweet Côtes de Bergerac wines. Enjoying meeting people and sharing my knowledge, I am keen to let you discover my profession and passion through many œnotouristic activities that I organise all year round.

Romain, a 30-year-old epicurean winemaker, decided to challenge himself in 2014: take over Château Haut Bernasse, a 14-ha property, and develop an organic agriculture. It has 11 ha of white (sémillon, muscadelle, white and grey sauvignon) and 3 ha of red (cabernet sauvignon, merlot and cabernet franc).
He grows these 35-year-old vines traditionally, with grassing and ploughed rows, for the purpose of making quality wines on this exceptional land.

The Mayet family was in the XVIth century a family of cathedral builders in the center of France.

They settled in South-West in 1852 on agricultural lands where they do polyculture.

In 1971, the first bottles of the Domaine du Bois de Pourquié were made and now the family exploitation is producing only wine, on a 30-ha surface.

Family area for 3 generations and manage today by families and Métifet Garcia.
Bergerac Domaine dominates the valley on the slopes of Monbazillac.
It is possible to stay in our cottages or guest rooms for short or long stay.
Our property cultivates 70 hectares, has monbazillac dominance.
To discover our vineyard, we have created a path retracing the entire domain

Push the door of the Domaine du Siorac: it is back in the world of vines and wine with ease; is to make a real encounter, share an authentic and warm moment.
With great pleasure we will show you our vineyards and surrounding landscapes, they are faithful witnesses to our history.
Without being a professional tasting, discover, over a drink, our productions and the many facets of our business.
Enjoy our guided tours from 12 July to 30 August: Tuesday morning at 10am and Thursday afternoon, at 2:30 p.m. (by appointment on other days / seasons).

Located on the right bank of Dordogne, 5km away from Bergerac, the 8 ha vines of Domaine de Coutancie grow on Prigonrieux hillsides, orientated south. Representinf the 5th generation of winemakers on the exploitation, Nicole Maury followed the path of her family and gives a feminine touch to the estate, in particular by working in oenotourism. She opened a lodge then, with the help of her children and her husband Hervé (breeding Limousin and Blonde d’Aquitaine cows), she put in place friendly moment to familiarize yourself with the wines of Domaine de Coutancie (AOC Rosette, Bergerac red, dry, rosé or Côtes de Bergerac) and it’s possible to buy directly there.

Family property since 1749, Château Moulin Caresse grows a 50ha-vineyard on the Montravel hillsides.

The estate is recognized for several years now by the TERRA VITIS and Haute Valeur Environnementale (HVE3) labels, thanks to the constant efforts made in every branch of the job (treatments, fuel, photovoltaic plant, waste management, etc.).

Come discover a large range of red, dry whites, soft, sweet and rosé wines.

You can taste our different cuvées, from the fruitiest to the most powerful.

We also propose holiday rentals.

The property represents 50 hectares of vineyards and produces wines of different appelations: Montravel, Haut Montravel, Bergerac and Pécharmant.
It offers a beautiful point of view of the Dordogne valley and is the departure of nices hiking trails.

Gérome, Dolores Morand Monteil and their children will welcome you to the Chateau Terre Vieille to show you the charm of their family vineyard and their Pécharmant wines made with love. The philosopher Maine de Biran was born in the Domaine de Grateloup and Terre Vieille is a dependency of the castle which we can see from the estate. History, rocks and good wines lovers will fall in love with this place!

5 minutes away from Bergerac and Monbazillac, Château Ladesvignes offers a panoramic view of Bergerac and the Dordogne valley, under the shade of a bicentenary cedar tree.

You are invited to discover and taste a complete range of wines: red, rosé, dry white, fortified or sweet. And of course, grape juice for children young and old!

On your own or in group, let yourself be tempted by various propositions: wine tasting from Monday to Friday, audio tour (French and English) in the warehouses and surroundings since May, wine and cheese tasting with commentary tour every Thursday in July and August.

You will enjoy everything as you wish. Car park, easy access and friendly welcome are waiting for you.

Vignobles Dubard settled their vineyards in 1977 in the western part of Bergerac Wine Region, called Montravel. The calcareous-clayish hillsides on the right bank of the river Dordogne, selected for their favourable exposure, offer to our 85-ha vineyard a diversity of exceptional terroirs that inspire our Bergerac & Montravel wines : aromatic dry white, fruity rosés, easy to drink to full-bodied red wines.

Organic wines AOP Bergerac.
Visits and tastings in the estate all year by appointment.

1610: This is the date when the BARDE family tree began to flourish in the commune of Saint Méard de Gurçon. Since that time succeeding generations have formed the present inheritance.
Here  in  “Perigord Pourpre”, the BARDE family practice the art of wine-making over their 60 hectares of vineyards, divided up as follows:      
-30 ha white wine varieties : Sauvignon, Semillon and Muscadelle.      
-30 ha red wine varieties : Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Malbec. Grown on wires that are staked in lines .
This ancient abode situated to the west of
Bergerac (30 km), though not a country seat,
it is however a landowners home dating from
the 17 th century. On the mansard roof sit two
splendid weathervanes marked with fleur-de-lis
and representing dolphins.

Little 12-ha-property overlooking at the beautiful Dordogne valley, Château le Tap is located on an old quarry site registered in Napoleonic cadaster, in the place called “Tas de pierre” (i.e. pile of stones) shortened as “au Tap”. This is a excepcional terroir with clay-limestone soils.

There are 5,000 vines in each hectare, constituted by 50% of white grape varieties (Sauvignon, Sauvignon Gris, Sémillon, Muscadelle et Chenin), and 50% of red grape varieties (Merlot, Cabernet franc,cabernet Sauvignon et Malbec), they have a great exposure on the hills. Our culture method is organic since 2007, certified in 2010, respecting terroir’s balance, without pesticides nor fertilizers.

At the heart of a Frenchie park, Château de Tiregand is an elegant seigneury of the XVIIIth century. Its 35ha vineyard is located on the Pécharmant hills. Overlooking the Dordogne valley on top of Bergerac, the “sand and rocks” soils of Perigord give raced and elegant wines which are left in barrels for 12 months. They are famous and have been rewarded by golden medals in every guide.

This 15ha family vineyard, created in the XVIIth century, is located at 3kms of Bergerac, perched on a high outside sitting area of Dordogne valley. We welcome those who want to share our winemaker spirit. We propose a wide range of 7 wines declined in dry Bergerac, rosé, red and Rosette.

At the heart of the south hills of Dordogne, with 57ha and plenty of medals, Château Court-les-Mûts will welcome you in its nice warehouses, its oenology laboratory and its wine museum. Meet and listen to the Sadoux family talk about wine and traditions while you will discover the art of tasting. Discover the peach and pear aromas of dry white wines, the exoticism of sweet wine, a rosé tasting like sweets, and intense red wines. Then, discover the quintessence of Saussignac coming from late harvests and early-maturing Semillon, that is to say a pretty rare wine!

Château Le Chabrier, settled in 1640, is situated on a beautiful hilltop overlooking the Valley of the Dordogne. Its vineyard of 20 hectares (49 acres) produces certified organic white and red wines that are much appreciated by faithful wine-lovers.  The vine is methodically and patiently cultivated so as to obtain a small yield and the wine is matured slowly.  This pursuit of quality, combined with one of the best Aquitaine soils, make Le Chabrier worthy of its international reputation and numerous prizes.

Delight your senses with a day or half day at an award winning organic and biodynamic vineyard estate that is also a certified WSET wine school. 
Experience gourmet pairings like wine and chocolate, a half day with a wine and food pairing lunch, wine growing and winemaking, or a full day playing the winemaker. Reception of groups of upto 20 people and accommodation for 6 people in two luxury ecological gites. 
Located between Bordeaux and Sarlat in Saussignac (20 mins west of Bergerac).

Since 1936  “Domaine Du Boyer” has been run by the same family for 3 generations.
The 15 hectare vineyard  is situated 12 kms south of Bergerac and is in the appellation area of Bergerac and Monbazilac
Visits to the vineyard with tasting and purchasing are available all year
Monbazillac, Bergerac red, white, and rosé.

30 acres vineyard, organic viticulture, managed by a passionate woman : "the passion and love of the vine that she brings is evident in every bottle of wine you open from Château La Robertie". She winemakes dry and sweet wines, rosé and red ones. Many of them have got medals.

Dive in the memory of Château Bélingard and discover a land named by the Celts as the “Sun Garden”.
Beyond an exceptional terroir, Château Bélingard has a true history content. At the heart of the appellations of Bergerac and Monbazillac, the vineyard stands on clay-limestone soils.

A dynamic area which is experiencing a renewal. The vineyard follows an organic production from its planting to its winemaking by proposing wine batches without sulphites.
Camper vans are welcomed.

Lovely little wine property located at 5km north west away from Bergerac. Charles Blanc creates high quality wines there and relies on the diversity of the grape varieties and the vinification methods while respecting the environment.

Located at 10 km south Bergerac on Dordogne left bank and with a surface of more than 10 ha, Château Kalian is completely settled in Monbazillac town. 90% of its exploitation area is dedicated to the creation of sweet wines.
Château Kalian is a 100% organic family property since 2012 which celebrated its 25 years anniversary in 2017. The name KALIAN comes from the mixing of their children names Katell and Kilian, who are two young oenologists. Kilian, their son, is now the owner of the property.
You will be welcomed with conviviality in a magnificent tasting room converted into an old barn with stone and stud walls.

Located on the north hill of Bergerac, Château du Rooy is a pretty property from the XIXth century that we bought in 1998.

It has a diversified vineyard where important investments were made for the vines and the vinification wine cellar. 
With a property of 19ha of vines and three appellations, we create our wines by respecting the land and biodiversity with a sustainable agriculture.

Contrary to family properties, Château du Rooy is first and foremost a viticultural adventure in which we try de recreate and develop the estate through time.

Now, we continue to reshape the exploitation for the purpose of improving the conditions of production as well as our wines’ quality.

The vineyard is located at the top of Pécharmant hill, oriented south. Tiny vine, with a view of Dordogne valley and Monbazillac hill. The land and vinification mixed together give this beautiful creation of an intense dark red wine with aromas of truffles, blackcurrants, and blackberries. This intensity and generosity underline a tannic structure that can age easily.

Old building of the Perigord

The Domaine des Costes’s name refers to the old French for “hillsides” (coteaux). It is located in Bergerac, one of the four towns producing Pécharmant appellation wines.

Since 1992, the vineyard is being cared of very carefully: replantation, poor yield, sustainable growing of vine, managing soils without weed killer.

Since 2003, the vine is worked in organic agriculture in an environmental way and in order to let the nature do its thing. We produce round, elegant and intense Pécharmant wines that you can keep for years. The rosé has delicate aromas.
Named “Campréal et des Costes vineyard” in 1903, and since 1975 “Clos les Côtes”. Sand and gravels of Périgord, wine of rich and subtle terroir, elegant hill.

Passionate winemaker working for 20 years in Pécharmant and Monbazillac. Elected winemaker of the year 2015.
My wines are the expression of my local products and my desires, that is to say a work comparable to a painting to which we give 12 or 24 months to create and live.

The countryside in the city of Bergerac
15Ha of vines AOC Pécharmant
Park with 100-years-old trees and 5 charming guestrooms

Château Poulvère is a former dependency of the Château de Monbazillac. Built in the 16th century, its construction is contemporaneous with that of the Château. The Borderie family has been established at the Poulvère property since 1923 when Louis Borderie was appointed estate manager. Château Poulvère wine estate encompasses 104 hectares, with all of the vineyards carrying the AOC (appellation controled) label. The estate comprises 54 hectares of Monbazillac, 12 hectares of Pécharmant and 38 hectares of Bergerac. château Poulvère is proud to be one of the most substantial wine estates in the Bergerac region, a successful business that remains a dedicated family enterprise.

The Château Vari, situated in Monbazillac, is a family-owned wine estate, producing organic wine since 2012. It covers 20 hectares in AOC Bergerac and AOC Monbazillac.
Since 1994, Sylvie and Yann Jestin have been producing open, well-balanced and delicate wines with character, on a clayey-limestone « terroir ». After going through the conversion period in 2010 and 2011, Château Vari now produces organic wines as from the 2012 vintage.
Attentive to the quality whilst respecting the « terroir », the Jestin family have always farmed the estate through ploughing the soil and limiting the use of chemical products. Convinced that organic farming is the future, Yann Jestin decided to start coverting the estate in 2009. The results are incredible : plants and wildlife have returned and the wines are even better!

In the heart of Monbazillac, on a hill overlooking the banks of the Dordogne and the historic town of Bergerac, the organic wines of exception of Château Grande Maison have been produced for decades (Monbazillac, Côtes de Bergerac, red/white Bergerac and rosé).
The thirteenth century fortified house has a unique environment :
- Overall exposure is south facing on more or less accentuated hills.
- The lake at the heart of the property offers an exceptional asset to promote botrytis, the fungus that creates the uniqueness and richness of Monbazillac
- The soil is clay-limestone with silica in places that gives a certain acidity.
With quality as the overarching objective, the entire production is subject to the rules of organic farming and the biodynamic method, allowing our wines to express their character and the best of this region.

Beautiful belvedere when you arrive at the estate, on a valley with a view on Dordogne’s valley and the Gironde hillsides of Sainte Radegonde.

Camper vans are welcomed.

Standing on beautiful hills, Château La Maurigne represents 17 ha with 5 ha of vines and 2 ha of orchards that are currently under organic management.
The fauna and flora are preserved in order to maintain the exploitation with an organic balance. During the summer, you can find at least 10 varieties of wild orchids in the vines.

Managed since 1999 by Vincent VESSELLE, Château La Rayre represents 25 ha of vines situated on the South Monbazillac clay-limestone hills in Colombier. All of this gather the best meteorological and geological conditions to make great wines. 
Biological agriculture and level 3 of HVE.

Tour/tasting from 11 am to 1 pm by the winemaker, from July 14 to August 15.

The place is inhabited by the Lambert family since the XIIIth century.

Domaine de Montlong is able to create unique wines thanks to its orientation on the hillside looking at the Dordogne valley and its traditional vinification methods. 

Camper vans are welcomed.

Lodge on rent during high season (Gîte de France, Tourisme & Handicap labels)

A vineyard reborn
After much patient, meticulous and passionate work, Château de Peyrel was restored to its original winemaking vocation in 2013. Our wines are elaborated in keeping with traditional craftsmanship, preserving both the plant and its fruit, in order to produce natural products of the highest gustative and aromatic quality.

At the heart of the plateau, hiking resting stop between Bridoire and Monbazillac.

Several levels of cuvées by appellation.

Campsite for campervans.

Estate planted in vines for several centuries, producing organic wines since 1991. Pioneer in the revival of Saussignac noble rot sweet wines.

Harvests are made by hand.

Wide range of wines, white, dry, rosé, red, soft and several cuvees of sweet wines in Saussignac appellation. 2 wines without sulphite: Cuvée Osée in Bergerac red and Richard Osé dry white.

A medieval château with its private 16th century chapel and  a half-timbered dovecote on columns,in the midst of a two acre park.
A  vineyard sitting  on a well drained limestone-clay plateau overlooking the Dordogne riverwhere can be found the traditional Bordeaux grape varieties : Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc for AOC Bergerac reds ; Semillon and Sauvignon for AOC dry Bergerac white and sweet Saussignac. The vineyard has a strict policy of not using any  herbicide. Our wines are the true expression of an exceptionnal terroir.

Château Cluzeau is foremost an ultra modern winery in an enchanting setting that offers organic and noble wines, developed in a strict respect of nature and biodiversity.
Château Cluzeau is also an unexpected scenography which speaks of the vine and wine with a playful perspective, dreamlike and unconventional.
It is a place for which the tour has been designed to allow adults and children, who have not been forgotten, fun memories of their holidays in Dordogne.

Château La Brie is located at the heart of Bergerac vineyard, on Monbazillac hills, with 35 ha and 2 lands. Originally private, the estate was bought in 1962 by the towns of Bergerac and Monbazillac in order for the Ministry of Agriculture to establish an agricultural and viticultural high school.
The wine estate is a real pedagogical tool, facing economic and environmental realities, which enable the teaching of the future winemakers.

Since 2013, Château La Brie owns the level 3 of the HVE norm (high environmental value certification), which officially shows the environmentally friendly policies used on the exploitation: such as biodiversity, health strategy, fertilizer management and water resources management. Furthermore, it has been certified Organic Agriculture since 2013 on 12 ha.

Château de la Mallevieille is a wine estate located in Monfaucon, a little town in Perigord overlooking the Dordogne river, in Bergerac town. The 30ha of vines are today manufactured by Philippe Biau and Thierry Bernardinis, who share daily a know-how and a common love for wine and vine.

The Domaine de Perreau is a family property of 20 ha covering the appellations of Bergerac and Montravel.

Gaëlle Reynou-Gravier, young winemaker from the 5th generation, took back the estate in 2013. She develops a new identity of the Domaine de Perreau: feminine and modern.

Since 2014, it is certified Terra Vitis®, for the pleasure of wine and a living land.

Visits of vine and wine cellars.

In 2018, Gaëlle developed a new family offer around a biodiversity vine walk. Kids and adults will be able to discover the profession of winemaker thanks to a 1.5km walk full of explanations, discoveries and games. At the end of the visit you will have a tasting for the parents and a snack for the children.

Château le Payral is a family property of which Thierry DAULHIAC is the youngest son. This the vineyard of 15 ha is situated about 20 km from Bergerac on the South of river Dordogne between vineyards of Monbazillac and vineyards of Ste Foy- Bordeaux. Grapes are produced without use of pesticides or chemical fertilizers. Since 2006, wines are organic. We have also been using principles of “biodynamie” in the Vineyard and in the cellar.   Its soils are clayey and limestone grounds. Area is so parcelled out.

In the heart of Bergerac vineyards, the Domain of Moulin Pouzy and its sunny hills cover 55 hectares.
The property belongs to the Castaing family since 1898 – the year of its creation.
At its head, Fabien Castaing represents the fifth generation of winegrowers.
Pampered vineyards, a well thought-out viticulture, high quality oenological and wine supports contribute to the making of fine wines.
These creations, made thanks to the meticulous work of men, honour Nature.
By strolling through vines and flavours, Fabien Castaing invites you to discover his world – world he wants unique, contemporary and rooted.
To show how we respect the Nature, the property has the certification " High Environmental Value".

Situated in the heart of the appellation of Bergerac, in the commune of Monbazillac, Château MONTDOYEN dominates with elegance a vineyard established on the surrounding slopes. The property covers 83 hectares including 37 which are planted with vines, the rest is divided between meadows and woods.  

To protect this exceptionnal environment - but also to express at best the characteristic of our soil, the whole domain is worked in the most natural way possible : green manure, mechanical weeding to favor the life of grounds…

So, Château MONTDOYEN was awarded many medals as in Lyon, Bordeaux, Brussels or at the Concours Général Agricole of Paris.
The Guide Hachette also recognizes the quality by having already attribued  several «coups de coeur», placing it among the references of the appelation.

Château de Panisseau, located at the heart of a vineyard, spread over 60 hectares, is happy to welcome you to the property for wine-tours and wine-tastings. Small propriety located on a clay-limestone plateau, converted to organic agriculture since 2011.

A winemaker dream: 18 contiguous hectares of vines, with a house in the middle of them, organic agriculture with an amazing panorama. 
Beautiful preserved terroirs and wines with a minimum of inputs.

The Château du Bloy itself exists since the beginning of the nineteen sixties. It was taken over in 2001 by Olivier LAMBERT and Bertrand LEPOITTEVIN-DUBOST with the objective to become one of the best in South west France. Wanting to keep the expressive taste of the "terroir" in the wines and, at the same time, preserve the environment, the Château, that had already been working organically for numerous years, formalised it in july 2011 and started the official process to become certified organic.

The Domaine du Castellat vineyard is located on the northeast slope overlooking the Dordogne Valley. It extends over 22 hectares of good wine-producing land.
The property is located on a strategic site considering its panorama. The origin of Castellat "Castellum" would go back to about the year 1000, and farther according to the Latin root.
Since then, six generations have taken care of the vineyard and the wine with progress...
Today, Jean-Luc and his Isabelle wife are the masters of the estate.
For them, more than a tradition, it is a true passion, which they share with their boys Hugo and Justin!...

Our vineyard is situated on one of the beautiful Dordogne hillsides overlooking a hidden valley of oak woodlands. Our aim is to produce excellent wines whilst respecting the nature which surrounds us. we have, for example, more than fifteen species of wild orchid. Our wines have won medals and Hachette awards.

Organic agriculture since 1989, belonging to the Nature and Progress appellation, I make sure my vineyard respects the lands, its biodiversity, by enjoying fauna and flora wealth to have the best of the land.
On an abundant energy soil, the vine draws everything it needs to produce the best grapes as possible. Once they are picked, they reveal all their aromas and of course the land’s wealth.
I am a farmer and a winemaker not a sorcerer’s apprentice!
After harvesting by hand, the wines in my warehouses are honest and authentic.
Every vintage is a reflection of the year. Each one of them tells a story.

This is the story of a family where two generations living in a viticultural property of the Bergerac region, at the heart of the Dordogne valley, put together their job passion, the importance of quality and opened up to others.
Three winemakers, Michel Durand, Julien Durand and Nicolas Pouget, produce big wines on this exceptional land: sweet whites, red and rosé, that are tasty, elegant and fruity.
The traditional work of the vineyard underlines the sustainable agriculture and development principles.
Independent winemakers since 2000 on a 26-ha exploitation, Eric grows and takes care of his vine until harvests, and Cécile is working organically since 2009.

Château Caillavel, formely known as Courson de Cailhavel Domain, noble den of 1322, invites you to come visit and taste their local products of Périgord. The latest represents what they do best in the region such as dry white wine, Côte de Bergerac red, rosé wine, and Monbazillac which was given a medal by Guide Hachette in 2017.

Wine grower and merchant owners, we are specialized in commercialization and wine production in the region of Bergerac. We deliver them in our points of sales and to restaurant professionals. 

The idea to make our own wine range came because we want to create Bergerac terroir wines that wear our signature. The partnership developed with some wine makers allows us a rigorous selection of parcels of land. A vinification and ageing in our wineries ensure the quality of our wines.

The Julien de Savignac wines have been appreciated since the first vintage: Guide Hachette (1998 to 2013), specialized press…
5-ha estate owned since 2015, and in organic agriculture since 2018. You can buy directly in the estate
Family exploitation since 1881. Old vinery: 40% of the surface is from 1928 or 1954. It is located at 2 minutes from the medieval city of Issigeac.

Family company for 30 years, the Chateau Tour des Gendres experiments new methods of vinification and viticulture to make sure that the expression of the different terroirs can be found in every wine, from the simplest cuvees to the gastronomy great wines. Come discover the delicacy and complexity of those dry white and red wines of the south hillsides of Bergerac.

The estate is located on Montravel hills between St Emilion & Bergerac. Great winery with performing equipment. Anual production about 400 000 bottles of Montravel & Bergerac red & rosé, Montravel dry   and Côtes de Montravel sweet white wines, regularly awarded at national & international competitions.

Château de Planques is one of the oldest properties of Monbazillac. The current owners are trying to maintain the traditional quality that makes the famous name of our little town.
Very large car park. Buses are welcomed.

On May 5th, 1960, the winemakers of the cooperative decided to buy the Château de Monbazillac and its estate. Historical monument, opened to the public, it is now the children and grandchildren of those winemakers who work for the preservation of the castle in order to make it accessible to as many people as possible. The castle presents a unique architecture which combines parts taken from the medieval architecture and others that show the ancient influence: The Renaissance style. This emblematic castle of Bergerac has been insensitive since the end of the XVIth century, whereas its wine quality was famous outside of the Aquitaine borders.

The Domaine de Pécoula and its characteristic values exist for 3 generations. Their key words are work, good sense, and constant searching of an irreproachable quality.

By coming to the estate, you will experience a simple, authentic and friendly welcome with the comments of the winemakers, from the grape to the bottle. You will taste Monbazillac, highly awarded, as well as Bergerac rosé, dry, soft and Côtes de Bergerac. 

Located 10km away from Bergerac at the south, the property is surrounded by vines from different grape varieties (Sauvignon, Sémillon, Merlot, Cabernet) and it is near the Château de Bridoire that you should visit if you are around!
You will also be close to the Bastides of Périgord.
Exploitation representing 20 ha of vines and 7 ha of plum trees located on the Monestier south hills.

For 500 years, the Goubault de Brugière family produces wine in our region of Bergerac. The property represents 24 hectares on the hills that go along the Dordogne.

Situated between Saint-Emilion and Sarlat, in Bergerac vineyard, Château Haut-Fongrive stands on the south region peak and south-west hills which are important pros for the quality of wines.
With a strong interest in wine, Doriane decided to settle in 2006 as a winemaker. Everything is to be done. The warehouse construction started in 2007 for the very first vinification of the estate.
Great vintage and expertise recognized by Vinalie d’Or Internationale (competition for the bests wines on an international scale).
Julien has joined his wife in this adventure since 2010. His youth and passion for the vine give a great boost to the exploitation. He works on improving the vineyard.
With the arrival of new technologies, there is an update for the wine warehouse and for the bottling room.
With market and technique, and their combination can be found today in today in their wines.
4 hectares owned in 2015
The foundations of the buildings dates from the Hundred Years War. The estate also welcomes collection cars and horses, our two other passions.

The Château Thénac estate is situated to the east of Bordeaux in the heart of the Périgord region, famed for its picturesque countryside, medieval castles, fine wines and black truffles.

The estate is located in the hamlet of Thénac and comprises in total almost 200 hectares.

The house is surrounded by rolling vineyards as far as the eye can see but the estate also includes plum orchards, ancient woodlands, lakes and farmland.

The property includes a small private Roe deer park as well as sheep, goats and other animals. The lakes host a menagerie of ducks and other wildfowl including a pair of rare black swans – the inspiration behind the label of the eau de vie made from our own plum orchards.

The principal parts of the Château are built on the ruins of a Benedictine Priory dating as far back as the 12th century (1109).

At the heart of a great vinicultural estate of 19 hectares stand the wonderful Chateau of Montaigne, a XIXth century home with its period furniture, and the historical tower of Michel Eyquem de Montaigne, the famous humanist who wrote Les Essais. 
 
All year you can walk around these places full of history during guided tours and finish with a tasting of our wines. A visual and tasty voyage that will leave you breathless!

The Château of Miaudoux is a farm that Gérard and Nathalie Cuisset have owned since 1987. They started their production and commercialization of Bergerac wine (white, dry and sweet, rosé and red) and Saussignac representing 25ha, and also a production of Agen prune representing 8ha.

In 2003, they decided to go from farming to organic agriculture, certified by Ecocert.

In 2014, Samuel and Lisa, their son and his wife, have joined the exploitation and now it is also converted in biodynamics, certified by Demeter.

Hence, some young parcels are worked with a horse in order to have a contact with the wild world and to minimize the tillage impact.
Of course they are looking for the quality of their wines.

The Clos du Pech Bessou is located in the South Bergeracois in the town of Plaisance and near Lot-et-Garonne, it is a touristic region because it is near the fortified towns of Eymet and Issigeac.

The Clos du Pech Bessou, little vineyard of 8 ha, is under the family tradition of Sylvie and Pascal THOMASSIN. They highlight the authenticity of the terroir. For us, vine culture is very important (sustainable agriculture) in order to have quality fruits that will allow us to have a vinification potential and to please our customers.

The grape varieties are: Merlot, Cabernet, Malbec, Sémillon and Muscadelle. They are the origin of the various and different types of wines.
